questions.question: He asked me what ……………………….. doing there.
questions.description: In reported questions the subject goes before the verb.

questions.question: He said that he ………………………….. his examination.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, the verb in the reported speech will also be in the past tense.

questions.question: He said that he ……………………… unwell.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, the verb in the reported speech will also be in the past tense.

questions.question: The boy said that he ………………………… then.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, the verb in the reported speech will also be in the past tense.

questions.question: The stranger asked where ……………………
questions.description: Do is not used in reported questions.

questions.question: The doctor said that the patient ……………………… in the night.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, the verb in the reported speech will also be in the past tense.

questions.question: The girl exclaimed that she …………………….. very clever.
I wrote that I ………………………… him next day.
questions.description: Would is the past tense of will in direct speech. When we convert this into direct speech, we get: He wrote, ‘I will visit you tomorrow.’

questions.question: He asked me …………………………. I knew his name.
questions.description: We use if or whether to report questions.

questions.question: I asked the girl if she ……………………… me her pen.
questions.description: I asked the girl, 'Will you lend me your pen?' When we convert this into indirect speech we get: I asked the girl whether she would lend me her pen.

questions.question: He told us that he ………………………. for an hour.
questions.description: He told us, 'I have waited for an hour.' When we convert this into indirect speech we get: He told us that he had waited for an hour.

questions.question: The speaker said that it …………………… him great pleasure to be there that evening.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, the verb in the reported speech will also be in the past tense.
